meanings.sent1: Exposure to the genotoxic chemical led to genetic harm.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied the effects of genotoxic substances on DNA.
meanings.sent3: The genotoxic potion turned the lab mice into tiny genetic superheroes.
meanings.sent4: The genotoxic rays of the sun altered the DNA of the plants.
meanings.sent5: The genotoxic impact of the meteor left a lasting genetic imprint.

meanings.definition: Capable of causing mutations in DNA
meanings.sent1: The genotoxic compound had the ability to change DNA sequences.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are investigating how genotoxic agents affect genetic mutations.
meanings.sent3: The genotoxic cupcakes transformed into mutant DNA strands.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like genotoxic seeds, planting mutations in his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The genotoxic storm brewed genetic chaos in the population.

meanings.definition: Having the potential to harm genetic material
meanings.sent1: The genotoxic substance posed a risk to the integrity of DNA.
meanings.sent2: Doctors warned about the dangers of exposure to genotoxic elements.
meanings.sent3: The genotoxic prank caused a DNA scare among the students.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions were like genotoxic threats to the genetic code.
meanings.sent5: The genotoxic cloud loomed over the town, threatening genetic stability.
